## Autocomplete Demo

This document demonstrates autocomplete for the now extension.

### Basic Usage

Type `{{< now ` and press space to see suggestions for date/time format aliases.

Copyright {{< now year >}}

### Try Autocomplete

1. Position your cursor inside `{{< now  >}}` below
2. Press `Ctrl+Space` or start typing to see alias suggestions
3. Each suggestion shows the alias name with an example output

{{< now  >}}

### Available Aliases

The following aliases are supported:

**Date aliases:**

- {{< now year >}} - Four-digit year (e.g., 2024)
- {{< now month >}} - Full month name (e.g., March)
- {{< now day >}} - Day of month (e.g., 29)
- {{< now weekday >}} - Full weekday name (e.g., Friday)
- {{< now date >}} - Short date format (e.g., 03/29/24)
- {{< now isodate >}} - ISO date format (e.g., 2024-03-29)

**Time aliases:**

- {{< now hour >}} - Hour in 12-hour format (e.g., 02)
- {{< now minute >}} - Minute (e.g., 30)
- {{< now ampm >}} - AM/PM indicator (e.g., PM)
- {{< now time >}} - Time in 12-hour format (e.g., 02:30 PM)
- {{< now isotime >}} - ISO time format (e.g., 14:30:00)

**Combined aliases:**

- {{< now datetime >}} - Date and time (e.g., 03/29/24 02:30 PM)
- {{< now isodatetime >}} - ISO date and time (e.g., 2024-03-29T14:30:00)
- {{< now timestamp >}} - Unix timestamp (e.g., 1711720200)

### How It Works

The extension provides autocomplete for all predefined format aliases in the `{{< now ... >}}` shortcode. These aliases provide convenient shortcuts for common date and time formats.
